intro: Corydalis grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 centimeters and features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to thrive in well-drained, moist soils. Corydalis grandiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
